short_summary: The Appellant seeks trade show booth management services from a vendor to set up, disassemble, manage logistics and deliver services for Forest Service's annual trade shows. The Appellant has two identical booths that need to be managed annually. The vendor will need to have experience in booth management, ideally with Forest Service. The vendor will also need to have experience having contracts with other large organizations. The vendor will be responsible for all aspects of the booth setup and tear down, including unloading the fields immediately after the snow melts in the spring and laboring in harsh temperatures. The vendor will also need to run their own track system for the rail car.

full_summary:
**Trade Show Booth Management Services**
=====================================

**Reference:** MX-443112940590

### Overview

Farm Credit Canada (FCC) is seeking a vendor to provide trade show booth management services for a period of three years, with the possibility of additional two (2) one-year terms. The vendor will be responsible for setup, disassembly, logistics, and other associated tasks.

### Tender Schedule

* **Release Date:** May 3, 2024
* **Proponent Questions Accepted Until:** May 10, 2024 at 14:00 CST
* **FCC Response to Proponent Questions Delivered Before:** May 21, 2024 at 17:00 CST
* **Tender Closing Date/Time:** May 31, 2024 at 14:00 CST

### Procurement Process

This procurement opportunity is governed by the Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA) and the Canada-European Union Comprehensive Economic and Trade Agreement (CETA). The Official Languages Act (Canada) also applies. The tender is non-binding and competitive.

### Requirements

* The vendor must have experience in providing similar services.
* The vendor must demonstrate expertise in booth management.
* The vendor must be able to provide services on an ongoing basis for three years, with possible additional terms.

### Tender Documents

The tender documents are available for download from the MERX website. It is the sole responsibility of the tenderer to ensure its compatibility with MERX. Tenderers must submit their proposals electronically through MERX, preferably in a PDF or MS Word file, before the tender closing date/time.

### Evaluation Criteria

Evaluation will be based on the tenderer's experience, expertise, and ability to provide services on an ongoing basis.

### Instructions

* Tender submissions must be made electronically through MERX.
* Tenderers are responsible for ensuring their submissions meet all requirements.
* FCC reserves the right to reject any tender submissions that do not meet all requirements.

### Contact Information

For further information, please contact Merveille Bashala at procurement@fcc-fac.ca or 000-000-0000. Please note that Merveille Bashala is the procurement manager, and this is their official contact information.

### Note

The tender schedule is subject to change at the sole discretion of FCC. Any changes will be communicated to all tenderers via amendment on MERX. Fees may apply to access the tender documents; please see https://www.merx.com/public/pricing for details.
